articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries to Be Commemorated in Australia
February Holiday Marked in Different Countries
Removal of Concrete Wall Demanded in Bulgaria
S. Korean Authorities' Deceptive Trick over FTA Negotiations under Fire
articles.content:
Removal of Concrete Wall Demanded in Bulgaria 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The Bulgarian Communists Union sent an open letter to the chief executive of south Korea on Jan. 31 demanding the removal of the concrete wall.
 The letter recalled that the Koreans have undergone the pain resulting from the division caused by foreign forces and the protracted efforts made by the DPRK to hasten the reunification of Korea resulted in the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration which marked the beginning of detente between the north and south.
 Expressing the belief that the relations between the north and the south would improve, the letter strongly demanded the south Korean authorities pull down at once the concrete wall built to block the reunification of Korea.    
 The letter reiterated the will of the union to raise higher the voices demanding the removal of the concrete wall.

articles.title: Negotiations for S. Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement under Fire
More Dynamic Struggle for Defence of Socialism Called for
articles.content:
Negotiations for S. Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement under Fire 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The Preparatory Committee for the "Peasants Federation for Recovering Agriculture" of south Korea reportedly made public a statement on Feb. 2 to oppose  negotiations for concluding a "free trade agreement" between south Korea and the U.S.
 The statement said that peasants' organizations can never allow the negotiations the government authorities try to hold in a bid to conclude the agreement with the U.S.
 The conclusion of the agreement is little short of sentencing peasants to death, the statement noted, accusing the authorities of trying to have the negotiations unilaterally in defiance of the opinion of the peasants who will be harmed by it.
 The authorities should cancel the negotiations and take fundamental measures for preserving agriculture, the statement said, and went on:    
 If the authorities push forward the unilateral negotiations, turning away their face from the demand of peasants, they would face social resistance.
 Peasants' organizations will wage a powerful struggle against the government in solidarity with all civic and social organizations.

articles.title: Papers Comment on Fascist Plot Disclosed in S. Korea
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Indonesian President
articles.content:
Papers Comment on Fascist Plot Disclosed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed in south Korea that the "East Berlin case" during the Park Chung Hee military fascist dictatorship was a sheer fabrication.
 In this regard Rodong Sinmun Monday runs a signed commentary, which says:
 This brings to light the truth behind the monstrous crimes of the predecessors of the Grand National Party who stamped out justice and patriotism and punished or killed innocent people in a bid to keep the heinous one-man fascist dictatorial system in south Korea.    
 In 1967 the then "Central Intelligence Agency" under the Park Chung Hee fascist regime made public the "East Berlin case" that stunned the world, alleging that more than 190 artistes, professors and doctors including Yun I Sang had conducted the operations for communizing south Korea with East Berlin as their stronghold. More than 30 overseas Koreans related to the big spy case were forcibly taken away to south Korea and harshly tortured. And others related to the case underwent brutal punishment beyond human imagination.    
 The gentries of the GNP are working hard to cover up the past crimes. In order to completely liquidate the crime-woven past characterized by flunkeyism and treachery, fascist dictatorship, anti-DPRK plots and the confrontation with the fellow countrymen and redress the wrong history in south Korea, the GNP, a group of traitors, should be punished, to begin with, for desperately checking the movement to set right the history.
 Minju Joson Sunday in a commentary says that the gentries of the GNP should apologize to the whole Korean nation for the crimes committed by their predecessors.

articles.title: Preparatory Work for Kimjongilia Festival at Full Swing
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Indonesian President 
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Indonesian President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono.
 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today by Nana Sutresna, special envoy of the Indonesian president who is political counselor to the president, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Koguryo-Related Books Published
New High Yielding Oil-bearing Trees Developed
articles.content:
Koguryo-Related Books Published
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The Publishing House of Social Science of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has published "Issues Related to Koguryo History" and "Castles of Koguryo", books on Koguryo which existed as a powerful state in the East for nearly a thousand years.
 The book "Issues Related to Koguryo History" has a prologue, an epilogue and eight chapters including "Building of Koguryo, World of Kings", "Course of Territorial Annexation and Integration by Koguryo", "Feudal Social, Political and Military Systems of Koguryo and Its Major Political Events" and "External Relationship, Independent Foreign Policy of Koguryo".    
 It deals with the territory, national power, relationship between Koguryo and neighboring countries, social system and other major issues related to Koguryo that had been distorted, fabricated and dwarfed by internal and external feudal historians and reptile historians of the Japanese imperialists and that have been clarified and corrected by the historical academy of Korea since the liberation of the country.
 The book "Castles of Koguryo" contains a prologue, an appendix and six chapters including "Distribution of Castles of Koguryo", "Castle Defense System of Koguryo", "Characteristics of Koguryo Castles" and "Influence of Castle Architecture of Koguryo Exerted on Surrounding Countries".    
 It says the prosperity of Koguryo was firmly guaranteed by the high degree of patriotism of the Koguryo people who regarded the national defence as the most sacred duty and by the castles that were the products of their distinguished creative power.
 Meanwhile, the publishing house brought out "Collection of Scientific Papers on Koguryo History" (two volumes).

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop All Joint Military Exercises with Outsiders
Kim Yong Nam Meets Special Envoy of Indonesian President
Greetings to PM of Grenada
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Special Envoy of Indonesian President
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Nana Sutresna, special envoy of the Indonesian president who is political counselor to the president, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and entourage of the special envoy and Bambang Irawan K., Indonesian charge d'affaires ad interim here.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Unit
articles.content:
Greetings to PM of Grenada
    Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Keith Mitchell, prime minister of Grenada, on the occasion of the 32nd anniversary of its independence.
 The message expressed the expectation and belief that the bilateral friendly ties would develop on good terms in the future, too.
